The claim is made by Senator Wendy Davis: who specifically accuses the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) of lying about the results of air quality studies in the Barnett Shale.
TCEQ conducted air sampling at 126 natur: which are known to be produced by various sources in the drilling process.
John Sadlier: deputy director of the office of compliance and enforcement at TCEQ, presented the results to the Fort Worth City Council, stating that the air is safe and no pollutants were found at levels that could cause health problems.
However: it is revealed that the samples were not collected, analyzed, or reviewed following specific quality control protocols, as stated in the red disclaimer on the slides accompanying the presentation. This raises concerns about the accuracy and reliability of the reported results.
